body_html:
I think this bug has been fixed somewhere down the line. @wilsonlym I reran your code on master and it now errors out with the following:

<ipython-input-6-0a8660ac7977> in forward(self, users, items)
     19         out = user_bias + item_bias
     20         import pdb; pdb.set_trace()
---> 21         out += (user_emb * item_emb).sum(1)
     22         return out.squeeze(1)
     23         ########################

RuntimeError: The expanded size of the tensor (1) must match the existing size (2) at non-singleton dimension 1

This implies the following fix to model1:

out = user_bias + item_bias
out += (user_emb * item_emb).sum(1).unsqueeze(1)  # added the unsqueeze(1)
return out.squeeze(1)

which results in the gradients from model1 and model2 being equal.

body:
I think this bug has been fixed somewhere down the line. @wilsonlym I reran your code on master and it now errors out with the following:
```
<ipython-input-6-0a8660ac7977> in forward(self, users, items)
     19         out = user_bias + item_bias
     20         import pdb; pdb.set_trace()
---> 21         out += (user_emb * item_emb).sum(1)
     22         return out.squeeze(1)
     23         ########################

RuntimeError: The expanded size of the tensor (1) must match the existing size (2) at non-singleton dimension 1
```

This implies the following fix to model1:
```
out = user_bias + item_bias
out += (user_emb * item_emb).sum(1).unsqueeze(1)  # added the unsqueeze(1)
return out.squeeze(1)
```

which results in the gradients from model1 and model2 being equal.
